channel.title: What are cases?
channel.description: I'm referring to 'case 2343' I've seen them, played with them but I never understood them or their functions or why their are specific case numbers. O.o

item.title: What are cases?
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

So, for example if you had.

If(playerNumber == ###) {
//stuff here
}

a lot of times

you could replace everytime you had that with a switch statement and case ####:

so

switch(playerNumber) {
case ####:
//stuff here
break;

}

Read full topic

item.title: What are cases?
item.dc:creator: @EwfsPrince EwfsPrince
item.description:
@EwfsPrince wrote:

Ooooh I guess that kinda makes sense. I’m familiar with the ‘if’ statements but doesn’t really flick the switch to fully understanding cases.
Correct me if I’m wrong.

The actual case is an alternative to the ‘if’ statement so case is just a shortcut right?
So a case is separated from other cases by their case number eg: case 2043, case 495

I’m a little bit confuse because from what I understood before case’s form functions for example the dialogue code in cases but I don’t understand how dialouge could have an ‘if’ statement unless it’s advancing to/form a previous dialogue chat.
But then again wouldn’t voids be easier to do this?

lol sounds like I’m confusing myself but I guess what I don’t understand is why would cases (which are ‘if’ statements) be called to do functions because I’ve seen cases do functions and if cases are ‘if’ statements then I don’t see why they would be used.

Read full topic

item.title: What are cases?
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

a variation of an ‘if’ statement.

Read full topic
